dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4230 IH: The Fund Our Border Not The IRS Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To transfer the unobligated balances of amounts made available to the Internal Revenue Service under the Inflation Reduction Act to the Secretary of Homeland Security to secure the border.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the The Fund Our Border Not The IRS Act of 2023.

section.header: Unobligated balances of the Internal Revenue Service made available to secure the border
section.text: The unobligated balances of all amounts made available to the Internal Revenue Service under Public Law 117â€“169 shall be transferred to the Secretary of Homeland Security and be made available for the salaries and expenses of agents and officers of U.S. Customs and Border Protection, constructing and maintaining physical barriers along the southern international border of the United States, and other purposes relating to border security.
